name: Pork Chop Packs
author: Lara Robinson
summary: Here's an easy dinner my Grandmother used to make. Pork chops are cooked with sweet potatoes, onions and apple in a little foil packet. Very simple and easy to make for one or for the whole crew. Serve with rice.
directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Lay out a piece of aluminum foil large enough to hold the ingredients
Place the pork chops, on the foil, then place the sweet potato, onion and apple over the chops
Fold up and seal each package
Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 45 minutes, or until the potato is soft when pricked with a fork
(Note: Do not open packages while baking as this will allow the steam to escape and will dry out the pork chops
Also, be careful when opening as the steam can burn
